title: Cannelloni with artichoke filling and tomato sauce

ingredients.content: 140 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
200 g smoked cheese (e.g. smoked scamorza, smoked Edam cheese), cut into pieces (4-5 cm)
20 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
40 g celery stalk, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place Parmesan cheese and smoked cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>15 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and oil into mixing bowl and sauté <b>3 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add artichokes and white wine and cook <b>15 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, without measuring cup<b>. Meanwhile, grease Varoma dish and tray.
<b>Insert measuring cup<b> and mix <b>40 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add ricotta cheese, 300 g reserved grated cheese, eggs, salt and pepper and mix <b>40 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a piping bag and allow to cool for a few minutes.

Pipe filling mixture into cannelloni tubes. Arrange filled cannelloni into greased Varoma dish and tray, leaving a little space between them and lightly brush the cannelloni with oil to avoid sticking. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

hintsAndTricks: Frozen artichoke hearts can be used instead of fresh or jarred.

Mushroom cannelloni: replace artichokes with 400 g sliced fresh mushrooms. In add mushrooms with white wine and cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1, without measuring cup. Drain mushroom mixture through simmering basket, transfer drained mixture into mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
- For meat-lovers, add 100 g pancetta or bacon after cooking for 15 minutes.
